results.title: Potomok Chingis-Khana = Storm over Asia
results.brief_description:
Set during the British occupation of Mongolia in 1920, this is the half heroic, half ironic story of Bair, a young Mongolian hunter-turned-partisan who is captured. A document in his possession identifies him as a descendent of Genghis Khan. The interventionists decide to ‘resurrect’ him as a puppet king. However Bair escapes and leads the Mongolian army against the interventionists. The intensity of the drama, strong feeling for landscape and dramatic use of montage (4 or 5 times the usual number of shots for a feature of this length) have been compared with the work of D. W. Griffith. In effect, the film is one long chase which takes on mythic proportions while the plot takes on metaphoric and lyrical dimensions (the British army is literally ‘blown away’). The emotional impact disguises the methodological rigour of Pudovkin’s construction. Also available on 16mm and VHS.

Credits: Director, producer, Vsevolod Pudovkin ; script, Osip Brik ; photography, Anatoli Golovnya ; music, N. Kryukov.
Cast: Valeri Inkizhinov.

results.title: Potatoes
results.creator_credit: Robert Lang, Roman Bittman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This documentary deals with the gradual shift from the family farm, to corporation-run farms, with all the ensuring problems and personal hardship. It is an incisive evaluation of what is happening in North America particularly St Johns Valley of New Brunswick and in world wide agriculture today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Lang, Roman Bittman and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Potash deficiency
results.creator_credit: Tony Doogood and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Potash deficiency occurs in older pastures ad sandy areas in Victoria. The rate of depletion is shown by the fact that 2 and a half tons of hay remove 1 cwt. of potash from the soil. The symptoms of this deficiency in pastures; how to apply potassium fertilizers; pasture management to prevent deficiency; the economics of costs and returns from the use of potassium fertilizers.

results.title: Pot purri
results.creator_credit: Rhoda Leyer, Cameron Guers, Grant Munro, Kaj Pindal, Derek Lamb, Jeffrey Hale, Vic Jobin, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A selection of publicity clips mounted together in one film to show techniques of NFB animators. As in ‘Hors d’oeuvre’, these films were produced originally for Government Agencies, to carry a message to the public about fire, water, traffic safety and mailing early for Christmas. Punctuated with adroit sound effects, each clip drives home its message humorously and succinctly.

results.title: Pot-Bouille = House of Lovers
results.creator_credit: Julien Duvivier, Raymond Hakim and Robert Hakim
results.brief_description:
Penniless Octave Mouret arrives in Paris at the turn of the Century to take up a job as assistant in a draper shop run by Madame Hedouin. She takes a fancy to him, as do two girls in the house where he lodges. In this adaptation of Zola’s novel Duvivier is less interested in Octave than in the life of the building, a real melting pot of the vices of the 19th century Paris bourgeoisie.

Credits: Producers, Robert and Raymond Hakim ; director, Julien Duvivier ; writers, Henri Jeanson, Leo Joannon, Julien Duvivier ; photography, Michel Kelber ; music, Jean Wiener ; art direction, Leon Barsacq.
Cast: Gerard Philippe, Danielle Darrieux, Dany Carrel, Anouk Aimee, Jacques Rispal, Jane Marken, Olivier Hussenot.

results.title: Posture and locomotion
results.creator_credit: Arnold Gesell and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Follows child development from helpless immaturity to controlled locomotion. First the infant only kicks and wriggles, then gradually he learns to control position and posture by pivoting, creeping, standing, cruising, walking and running. A consecutive biographic series depicting thirteen different age levels enables a detailed study of comparatively rapid progress.

results.title: Posture and exercise
results.brief_description: This film explains muscle action, and the physiology of exercise. Concepts presented include the relation of the nervous system to the skeletal muscles, motor units of work, development of endurance, muscle tonus in relation to posture, and peripheral circulation as it is related to physical efficiency.

results.title: Postman Pat: Pat's thirsty day
results.brief_description: Postman Pat and Jess have to go out in all kinds of weather to deliver the mail - not even heat and wind and fog will stop them! “Pat’s Thirsty Day” shows the old village water pump being used again during a water shortage in Greendale. “Pat’s Windy Day” shows strong winds creating havoc for the villagers as trees, telegraph poles and even Pat’s letters get blown around. “Pat’s Foggy Day” finds Pat and Jess losing their way in heavy fog, and they must follow the sound of the church bells to find their way home again.

results.title: Postman Pat: Pat's rainy day and other stories
results.brief_description: Join Postman Pat in the village of Greendale with his black and white cat, Jess, in three more enchanting stories about life and the mail service! In “Pat’s rainy day”, heavy rain causes big problems for Pat and the other villagers, but the mail must go through! In “The sheep in the cloverfield”, Pat has to play Bo Peep and help round up the sheep before he can continue his own rounds. In “Pat’s tractor express”, Pat enlists the help of Miss Hubbard and a tractor to deliver a registered letter across the country.
